content.title: Flinders St car attack driver pleads guilty to murder - ABC News
content.desc: By Karen Percy A man who killed an elderly man and injured others when he drove through a busy intersection on Flinders Street in Melbourne four days before Christmas last year has pleaded guilty. During a brief hearing in the Supreme Court of Victoria, Saeed Noori, 33, admitted to one charge of murder, 11 counts of recklessly causing serious injury and five counts of reckless conduct endangering life. Sixteen others were injured — many of them foreign nationals — when Noori drove at about 50 kilometres per hour by Flinders Street Station in the city at about 4:30pm on December 21. The 17 c...
